meanings.definition: An opening in a wall or door through which something can be viewed.
meanings.sent1: The viewports in the fence allowed us to see the beautiful garden on the other side.
meanings.sent2: I peeked through the viewport in the door to see who was knocking.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat tried to squeeze through the tiny viewport in the gate.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like viewports, revealing her emotions to everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The old castle had viewports in the stone walls, giving a glimpse of the outside world.

meanings.definition: A small window on a computer screen that displays a different part of a document or image.
meanings.sent1: I moved the cursor to the edge of the viewport to scroll down the webpage.
meanings.sent2: The photo editing software has multiple viewports for easy navigation.
meanings.sent3: The busy designer had viewports open for each project, making multitasking easier.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a viewport, constantly switching between different thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The video game displayed the map on a small viewport in the corner of the screen.
